dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they promised to keep surprising us with, uh, innovative, technologically advanced products and services. So, more to come, it seems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, about the survey itself â€“ PwC actually talked to 71 CEOs from major Kazakh companies across various sectors. That's, like, a really significant sample.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And what stood out was that these CEOs specifically mentioned Kaspi.kz's successful IPO, the professionalism of their management team, their innovative technology, and, um, Lomtadze's strategic vision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it wasn't just, like, a general pat on the back. These were really specific points. And PwC's been doing this CEO survey worldwide for 24 years, and for the past nine years in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.text: Which gives it, you know, a lot of credibility. They're trying to understand CEOs' views on the global and national economic situation, opportunities, risks... so it's a serious piece of research.
